question.text: David Tilman's experiment is related to?

options.text: Role of species diversity in ecosystem stability.
Role of dominant species in stability of ecosystem.
Role of human being in maintaining ecosystem.
More than one option is correct.

solution.text:
A community is said to be stable when its populations size of all species remains same over a period of time. In other words, the population is not showing much change or variation and is able to withstand any hardships or changes in the environment. A stable community is not affected by invasion of other organisms including alien species. It resists loss of biodiversity.

David Tilman is an American ecologist whose work with outdoor plots in study of ecosystem led to the observation that in an area with more variety of species showed less variation in total biomass. His experiments showed that increased diversity contributed to higher productivity. His study helped in better understanding the role of species diversity in ecosystem stability.
